metadata.title: Week 1 Day 2: Introduction to Latin Nouns

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of the Latin alphabet and pronunciation rules. They should be familiar with the concept of nouns in English, including singular and plural forms. The previous lesson introduced the idea of Latin as an inflected language, where word endings change to convey meaning. Students should also recall the importance of word roots and derivatives in understanding vocabulary.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, we introduced the Latin alphabet and practiced pronunciation. We also discussed the concept of inflection in Latin and how it differs from English.
misconception_watchlist: Assuming Latin word order is the same as English

primary: Introduce Latin nouns and their basic forms
Understand singular and plural in Latin

lesson_flow.description: Review the Latin alphabet and pronunciation rules from the previous lesson.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students recite the alphabet and practice pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the concept of nouns in Latin, focusing on singular and plural forms.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and take notes on the differences between Latin and English nouns.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use examples to illustrate singular and plural forms.

lesson_flow.description: Practice identifying singular and plural nouns in Latin using examples.
lesson_flow.student_action: Work through examples with the teacher, identifying singular and plural forms.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Provide immediate feedback and correct misconceptions.

lesson_flow.description: Students complete a worksheet identifying singular and plural nouns.
lesson_flow.student_action: Complete the worksheet individually, then pair up to discuss answers.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to provide support and answer questions.

lesson_flow.description: Summarize the key points of the lesson and preview the next topic.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in a brief discussion and ask any remaining questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Highlight the importance of understanding noun forms for future lessons.

behavior.loop_behavior: Repeat instructions if students seem confused, using different examples.
